channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 乌克兰和俄罗斯正在进行一场窃取情报和制造恐慌的战斗。但到目前为止，没有人赢得这场网络战争。了解原因： 谢尔盖-迈杜科夫
item.description:
Ukraine and Russia are locked in combat to steal intelligence and sow panic. But so far, no one is winning the cyber war. Learn why: https://t.co/PA3fvgMQwX

Illustration: Sergiy Maidukov pic.twitter.com/0E1MFOQug9

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 哈马斯恐怖分子在 10 月份犯下暴行后，以色列发动了一场正义的自卫战争。今天，以色列已经摧毁了哈马斯一半的武装力量。但在一些重要方面，以色列的任务失败了👇。
item.description:
After the atrocities committed by Hamas terrorists in October, Israel launched a justified war of self-defence.

Today it has destroyed perhaps half of Hamas’s forces. But in important ways its mission has failed https://t.co/mPEnlmfddu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 据英伟达（Nvidia）公司的黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）称，他的公司将率先为下一次工业革命建造 "人工智能工厂"。但对于这家芯片制造商来说，前方可能会有障碍👇。
item.description:
According to Nvidia’s Jensen Huang, his company is first in line to build the “AI factories” for the next industrial revolution. But hurdles may lie ahead for the chipmaker https://t.co/3yBfkemoFz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 加沙战争一开始就很清楚，以色列的两大目标--消灭哈马斯和解救人质--是不一致的。以色列造成的破坏将使战后几乎不可能建立一个稳定、和平的政权
item.description:
It was clear from the outset of the war in Gaza that Israel’s two main goals—to eliminate Hamas and free the hostages—were at odds.

The devastation Israel has unleashed will make it almost impossible to institute a stable, peaceful regime after the war https://t.co/aXms1llIhv

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 欧洲毒品非刑罪化进程可能放缓
item.description:
Drug decriminalisation in Europe may be slowing down https://t.co/JhxFgeRv0q

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 为什么《怪诞经济学》未能改变经济学
item.description:
Why “Freakonomics” failed to transform economics https://t.co/Uh3C5x5ZXZ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。它在皮肤上染上的黄色可能具有欺骗性和致命性。一个国家有一种开明的处理方法 👇
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Its skin­-staining yel­lowness can be deceptive and deadly. One country has an enlightened way of dealing with it https://t.co/cSSHSCfHOz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 作为中国加强对香港控制的象征，被称为 "23 条 "的国家安全法受到了一定的冲击。这项新通过的措施赋予当局更多的权力来镇压异见人士👇。
item.description:
As a symbol of China’s tightening grip on Hong Kong, the national-security law known as Article 23 takes some beating.

The newly-passed measure grants the authorities more powers to clamp down on dissent https://t.co/UZFQID6PaD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 人工智能制作音乐并不是什么新鲜事。但一些公司认为，他们已经找到了利用人工智能复制用户 "独特音乐指纹 "的方法👇。
item.description:
AI music-making is nothing new. But some firms reckon that they have found a way of using AI to reproduce the “unique musical fingerprint” of their users https://t.co/mltvnncDgA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 据英国 Bully Watch 估计，XL Bullies 的致命率是所有其他犬种总和的 270 倍。
item.description:
XL Bullies are 270 times more deadly than all other dog breeds combined, estimates Bully Watch UK.

Generations of breeding are to blame https://t.co/GlNKrSCAvS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 理想的盟友应该是法国这样的大国、爱沙尼亚这样的坚决国家和荷兰这样的有凝聚力的国家。但那些鹰派盟友都是小国，许多大国都身无分文，德国也犹豫不决。
item.description:
Ukraine has a problem: its EU allies are either broke, small or irresolute.

Ideally an ally would be big like France, resolute like Estonia AND solvent like NL. But those that are hawkish are small, many big countries are broke—and Germany is hesitant.https://t.co/ZFjWdjvzgv pic.twitter.com/ngKtKY5QH3

— Stanley Pignal (@spignal) March 22, 2024

item.title: 中国的独生子女政策并不是中国生育危机的主要原因--许多东亚国家的出生率都出现了骤降。但独生子女政策留下的后遗症将使其难以摆脱：中国父母认为一个孩子是最理想的，这一点很突出
item.description:
China's one-child policy is not the main reason for the country's fertility crisis - many East Asian countries saw birthrates plunge. But its legacy will make it uniquely hard to escape: Chinese parents stand out for thinking one child is the ideal https://t.co/U9LqHjRNJ3

— David Rennie 任大伟 (@DSORennie) March 22, 2024

item.title: 丰富的旅客意味着投资者丰厚的回报
item.description:
Rich travellers mean rich returns for investors https://t.co/SbALlJXckE

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: "古查兰-达斯认为："今天，像我这样的印度自由派人士面临着两难境地：我们不仅没有人可以投票支持，而且即使有，他们也无法当选。"这感觉就像一条孤独的路"
item.description:
“Today, Indian liberals like me face a dilemma: not only do we have no one to vote for, but even if we did they would be unelectable,” argues Gurcharan Das. “It can feel like a lonely road” https://t.co/3evQGtzDBZ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024
